Detailed Description

CmdCut class is the cut command stored in the command stack.

CmdCut represents a single cut action on a scene, removes selected node from the scene and stores it in the clipboard.

See also:
CmdCopy, CmdPaste, CmdDelete

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CmdCut::CmdCut ( const QModelIndex &  selectedIndex,
SoNode *&  clipboard,
SceneModel *  model,
QUndoCommand *  parent = 0 
)

Creates a new cut command that represents the cut the node located with index from the model. The node is stored at the clipborad.

If parent is not null, this command is appended to parent's child list and then owns this command.

References InstanceNode::children, InstanceNode::GetNode(), InstanceNode::GetParent(), m_coinNode, m_coinParent, m_pModel, m_previousNode, m_row, and SceneModel::NodeFromIndex().

CmdCut::~CmdCut (  ) 

Destroys the CmdCut object.

References m_coinNode.

Member Function Documentation

void CmdCut::redo (  )  [virtual]

Applies a change to the scene and clipboard. After redo() clipboard will contain the node located on the model as index and the node will remove from the scene.

See also:
undo().

References SceneModel::Cut(), m_coinNode, m_coinParent, m_pClipboard, m_pModel, and m_row.

void CmdCut::undo (  )  [virtual]

Reverts clipboard and scene contain. After undo() is called, the state of the scene and clipboard will be the same as before redo() was called.

See also:
redo().

References m_coinNode, m_coinParent, m_pClipboard, m_pModel, m_previousNode, m_row, SceneModel::Paste(), and tgc::Shared.
